turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Lymphogranuloma venereum.
turn.2: Lymphogranuloma venereum Lymphogranuloma venereum (LGV) (also known as "Climatic bubo", "Durand–Nicolas–Favre disease", "Poradenitis inguinale", , "Lymphogranuloma inguinale" and "Strumous bubo") is a sexually transmitted disease caused by the invasive serovars L1, L2, L2a, L2b or L3 of "Chlamydia trachomatis".
turn.4: LGV is primarily an infection of lymphatics and lymph nodes.
turn.5: What is the cause of the infection?
turn.6: " Chlamydia trachomatis" is the bacteria responsible for LGV.
turn.8: It gains entrance through breaks in the skin, or it can cross the epithelial cell layer of mucous membranes.
turn.9: What are the symptoms of the infection?
turn.10: The organism travels from the site of inoculation down the lymphatic channels to multiply within mononuclear phagocytes of the lymph nodes it passes.
turn.12: In developed nations, it was considered rare before 2003.
